transcendence

Class Zeta

  • java.lang.Object
    • transcendence.Zeta

  • public final class Zeta
extends Object
    Z function approximation for Riemann's Zeta function on the critical line, (0.5+it).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Zeta() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double z(double imaginaryPart)
      Calculates Z(0.5 + it) where t is the imaginary part argument.
      static double zeta2N(int n)
      Calculates Zeta(2 * n) for positive real integer, n.
      static double zetaMN(int n)
      Returns Zeta(-n) for positive integer, n, greater than 1.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • z

        public double z(double imaginaryPart)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Calculates Z(0.5 + it) where t is the imaginary part argument.
        Parameters:
        imaginaryPart -
        Returns:
        Z(0.5 + i*imaginaryPart), approximation of zeta function at this point.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if imginary part is non-positive

      • zeta2N

        public static double zeta2N(int n)
        Calculates Zeta(2 * n) for positive real integer, n.
        Parameters:
        n - positive real integer.
        Returns:
        Zeta(2 * n)

      • zetaMN

        public static double zetaMN(int n)
        Returns Zeta(-n) for positive integer, n, greater than 1.
        Parameters:
        n - positive integer
        Returns:
        zeta value
